info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 28 at 3:01PM CDT until March 30 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTRY PRECIPITATION LIKELY TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING... .A complex storm system will develop over the Plains Tuesday, then shift across the area Tuesday night through Thursday. The initial surge of precipitation moving out ahead of the storm will push across the area Tuesday night into Wednesday morning. The precipitation will likely begin as a mix of snow, sleet and freezing rain, change to mainly freezing rain during the night, and then to just rain as temperatures edge above freezing Wednesday morning. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Snow and sleet accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations around one quarter of an inch possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Wisconsin. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute. Ice building up on trees and power lines could result in some power outages.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
